page.title: 07EDUCATION
page.content: The 18th century house standing in six acres of ground on the edge of High Ongar village was originally the rectory.In 1980 it was purchased by the Trustee Savings Bank and has become a training school for bank employees from England and Wales.They also have a similar school in Birmingham and one at St.Helens near Liverpool.Approximately 25 people at one time attend this adult residential training centre on courses lasting from 3 days to 2 weeks.The majority being 1 week,Monday to Friday.There are basically 2 types of courses.One for the technical side of banking, and the other one for management training. Once or twice a year there is a pre retirement session.the ages catered for therefore stretches from 18 to 65. The people attending courses usually ask,but some are sent by branches.
